intro: Liabum deppeanum, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Liabum deppeanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
